brief.brief: The value to store in the stathistory table when the Store Results field evaluates to true.
Each time an agent runs, it creates one stathistory record for each query with a corresponding Stat Name.
When a Stat Name exists, and the Store Results is checked (or otherwise set to true), the queries' counts post to a stathistory table.

detail.detail: Since agents typically run their queries repeatedly, based on repeat intervals specified in their corresponding agent schedule records, this feature produces recurring data points for trend analysis.

If you use this feature in agents with frequent repeat intervals, the stathistory table grows quickly. Create separate agents specifically for collecting trending statistics and schedule the trending agents for longer intervals: hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly.
